title: Authors and Citation
text: Girma T, Legoupil E (2023). unhcrshiny: UNHCR branded shinydashboard. R package version 0.1.0.
code: @Manual{,   title = {unhcrshiny: UNHCR branded shinydashboard},   author = {Tariku Girma and Edouard Legoupil},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.1.0}, }

title: UNHCR branded shinydashboard
text: package yet CRAN install , need pak package.

title: UNHCR branded shinydashboard
text: simply call function within dashboardBody app. See simple example follow ShinyDashboard Get Started apply unhcrthemes plots!
code: ## you can then run the app locally with library(shiny) library(shinydashboard) library(unhcrshiny)   ui <- dashboardPage(          dashboardHeader( title = "UNHCR Dashboard"),          dashboardSidebar(             sidebarMenu(              menuItem(  "welcome", tabName = "welcome", icon = icon("house")),              menuItem(  "upload", tabName = "upload", icon = icon("upload"))            )           ),          dashboardBody(            ## Get the theme here!!             theme_shinydashboard_unhcr(),            h1("Title 1"),            h2("Title 2"),            h3("Title 3"),            p("Text"))  )   server <- function(input, output) { }  shinyApp(ui, server)

title: Theme_shinydashboard_UNHCR — theme_shinydashboard_unhcr
text: Theme shinydashboard application UNHCR Brand https://www.unhcr.org/brand

title: Theme_shinydashboard_UNHCR — theme_shinydashboard_unhcr
text: function inject custom css within head page See also https://rstudio.github.io/shinydashboard/appearance.html

title: Theme_shinydashboard_UNHCR — theme_shinydashboard_unhcr
